snippet: In the current Congress, where almost all legislation goes to die, there is a surprising movement toward sentencing reform.
abstract: Editorial offers hope that Congress can achieve the first major reforms to America's broken criminal justice system in over a decade; notes two bills that would reduce jail overcrowding by reducing minimum sentences for nonviolent drug crimes and allowing prisoners to earn credit for early release; says bills contain elements that appeal to both right and left, increasing likelihood of passage.
lead_paragraph: In the current Congress, where almost all legislation goes to die, there is a surprising movement toward sentencing reform.

headline.main: A Rare Opportunity on Criminal Justice
